website_summaries.verdict: A true conical burr grinder that gives you a consistent grind, up to a half-pound at a time.
pros: Gives you a full flavor, consistent grind without heating bean
Offers settings to select beans for between 1 and 14 cups of coffee
Attractive and produces an even grind
cons: Difficult to pull the bin out without spilling the grounds
Will not grind if everything isn't lined up perfectly, but this is for safety reasons

customer_reviews.title: Find something better
customer_reviews.text: The advert is very compelling, removable mill and all, but the reality is that the lid for the container easily falls into said, because it is much smaller the the conical shape of container and in addition, I have had to "Feed" the coffee beans because the plate inside the reservoir inhibits the free passage of beans. I can't wait for this to break, or I might treat myself with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Zanotti

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grinder, but the static electricity generated is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: The grinder itself is very high quality and does a great job grinding from espresso through french press settings. But my biggest gripe is that the STATIC ELECTRICITY generated by the process is almost maddening. Electrically charged grounds everywhere, sticking to everything. I swear because of this, I waste half the grounds! Anyone have advice how to overcome this??
customer_reviews.author: Amanda T.

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder, static an issue
customer_reviews.text: I like the grinder, all the settings are nice and it is easy to use. However, due to static, the ground coffee sticks to everything plastic, and that includes the ground coffee container and all surfaces of the machine. Because of the static, opening the ground coffee container is like subjecting myself to a little explosion of ground coffee every morning and cleaning up ground coffee from all surfaces in the vicinity of the machine, and the machine itself, is annoying to have to deal with every morning. Hoping this is only a winter problem. The grinder performs well for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kiirekass

customer_reviews.title: I really like this grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder to replace another the regular conical burr grinder from Cuisinart. I like this one a lot more. The conical burr produces less coffee dust and a very consistent grind. The really fine powder was always an issue on the standard burr grinder. Hopper pours better into the coffee maker due to the shape of the hopper. This results in less spillage when dumping into the machine. Still really easy to use with the grinding timer that grind the proper amount of coffee for the number of cups you want to brew.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A fly in the ointment
customer_reviews.text: The static cling issue may end up being a deal killer. Everything about the machine is well-thought out and using it couldn't be easier. Except for getting the grounds out of the plastic catch container. It literally will cling to the outside when you try to empty it. It makes a mess. If anyone has figured out a cure, please share. So far, the best solution I've tried is putting aluminum balls made from foil in the container and shaking it a bit before trying to dump out the grounds. It helps a little.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Very good upgrade from previous model
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous cheaper Cuisinart model for about 10 yrs until it broke last week. It didn't get everyday use but probably did a pound of coffee per month. It was loud and created a lot of fine dust with the high speed st. st. blades. I purchased this model as a replacement/upgrade. It works well. Quieter, easy to clean, better grind, and no fine dust. As long as it continues to work, i will say it is a good buy for the price. Negative reviews IMHO are over critical.
customer_reviews.author: WeegieB

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present. Seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my father in law who has gotten into coffee a lot more than I ever have. He was after a conical bur grinder and this one was what was recommended. He says he really likes it and actually brought some pores coffee over that he grinded. I could see the grind was very even, the coffee seemed to taste pretty good. Not sure if that's from the coffee itself or if the grinder really makes all that much of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for awhile now it doesn’t grind in the auto drip setting. If you watch the video you can see as I am turning it from 18 down into the auto drip the lcd number rested back to 18. This also happens coming up from espresso settings. Not sure what to think now.
customer_reviews.author: SkierBrian

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grinder and it gets the job done, although a little staticky when the grounds enter the hopper, there are some hacks on YouTube which supposedly deal with the problem which I have not tried yet. I have my unit sitting on a small, indented nylon cutting board to catch any stray grounds, and I use a soft bristled brush to sweep them off the hopper platform. It's easy to clean. Just run some minute rice through it after removing, cleaning, and reinserting the burr. The rice cleans out the buildup pretty good. Hopper comes off, cleans,and reattaches easily. A good grinder for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Calm down it’s an affordable conical burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand all these nit picking reviews about the ‘static’ and how it’s ‘hard to clean’ I’ve had very little issues with the static and it’s much easier to clean than a lot of flat burr grinders. It’s relatively quiet. I don’t think people realize this is a high quality grinder in affordable packaging. The hourglass shape of the canister is weird but I can use my TECHNIVORM Moccamaster scoop and level it off without spilling. And the static? It happens. It’s a plastic canister. Literally tap it a couple times and it’ll all settle. Maybe people are using old dry beans?
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: Wide range of grind choices, and the amount that you grind. Easy to set for your needs, Noise is moderate, and totally acceptable. Yes the plastic bin for the ground coffee does have a "static" residual, but every grinder with a plastic bin will have some static residue. This works, has a wide range of settings, and will grind your coffee beans as good as many more expensive grinders.
customer_reviews.author: ValentinaCD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Cuisinart conical burr grinder for over a year now and it is fabulous. I grind beans for regular coffee every morning and they come out perfectly. There is no jamming. Yes, there is static cling, but I think you would find that in any machine. Give the plastic grounds holder a couple of good whacks before you pour it into the coffee machine and it will be all right. I also use it for espresso - perfect fine grounds every time. I just recently purchased a French Press coffeemaker and it grinds perfect coarse grounds for that too. It's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: mallory0405

customer_reviews.title: High Satisfaction, and a Suggestion for anyone complaining about static electricity
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. It does EXACTLY what it is advertised to do. I needed it to replace a Starbucks conical grinder I had for about fifteen years. One of the complaints I see is dealing with static electricity. Here's a very simple suggested solution: Take a single laundry fabric softener sheet and simply wipe the sides of the container. All the ground coffee freely slides wherever you like. You don't have to do it very often to make the plastic "slightly" conductive, and you don't have to create aa special solution. They're already on the sheets. Try it. Yes, I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: consistent
customer_reviews.text: Good overall grinder for the price with different modes and manually modes. The grinds appear very consistent, easy to clean. I have not used this for espresso however as I have a separate stepless grinder so I cant speak to that but it seems to do that trick for what I use it for. Its a little larger that I expected but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: John McCarroll

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: THe container that the coffee grinds dump into broke and was leaking everywhere. ATtempt to tape that up was partly successful and now the whole thing bottom fell off with coffee grinds all over my kitchen counter! Not worth this money. Also coffee comes out very uneven with grind particle size!
customer_reviews.author: dr D

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Static causes a huge mess with every grind ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Static causes a huge mess with every grind. The grinder doesn't actually grind beans unless I forcibly push down on the top of the hopper while grinding. The grounds receptacle doesn't fit into place because of the insane amount of static cling grounds trapped behind it. This is a seriously disappointing Cuisinart product. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Basket doesn't stay in the grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like the selections of ground size and cup amount. The most frustrating thing is that the basket doesn't stay in the grinder. Even if you jam it in it will take a few attempts. Once it's in you can't rely on it to stay in place and usually comes out after a few seconds and the grinder halts. I have a couple of other Cuisinart products that I'm very pleased with (incredible food processor) but this has been disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I had the older unit that preceded this model. It was louder, this is less so. Two things I dislike about this unit: 1) the plastic on the grounds catch bin is insanely thin and poor quality, 2) the mouth of the grinder constantly drops ground coffee onto the base after the clear bin is removed making clean up and reinsertion of the bin difficult.
customer_reviews.author: blackjack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of quality performance and price.
customer_reviews.text: After doing my own research I must concur with the popular belief that conical bur grinders are necessary to produce a grind worthy of the effort. The price of these units however would lead one to expect fifty year old scotch to come out the other end as opposed to coffee grounds. This unit is well built, easy to operate, easy to clean and priced much more reasonably than most other brands. Use quality fresh beans and the coffee is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Its difficult to seat the container that the ground coffee Falls into.....
customer_reviews.text: Getting the cup that receives the ground coffee in position to the grinder so it will run is time consuming. The spout where the ground coffee comes out clogs easily and has to be manually cleared. It's been a malfunction from the beginning. I never know what will make it grind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, but messy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine coffee grinder which allows all sorts of settings. I would venture that one could find about any setting desired. So, I am pleased and have given the device 5 stars. At the same time, it is incredibly messy. When you remove the plastic container with the ground coffee, grounds spill out in the device and on the counter surface. Nine out of ten times, you will have to brush out the recess where the container goes in order to replace it. This is really a relatively minor issue, and I certainly recommend the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M. Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: First time buyer
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time purchasing a burr grinder and so far I'm happy with it. The only thing I noticed is that I have to tap it several times before I remove the container so ground coffee does not fall to the bottom after I remove the container.
customer_reviews.author: Rena

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I love this thing, the settings are simple and they vary in a wide range of grain sizes. It is relatively quiet and quick. My only gripe is that there is no on/off button, so you have to unplug it when you are done. Recommend this for certain.
customer_reviews.author: STIRKK

customer_reviews.title: So much much quicker
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched from a smaller grinder to this grinder with a bean hopper. Grinding beans is so much quicker. Just push the button and it grinds the predetermined amount of grinds at the predefined fineness. When the hopper gets low just pop off the top and pour more in. It is a bit loud but given the size and price point that is acceptable. As someone that is picky I recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: JPB

customer_reviews.title: HERE IS A SOLUTION FOR THE STATIC PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine grinder and indeed the flying coffee grounds are a nuisance. I decided to put science to work. Before each use I wet my finger and when it is almost dry I rub it along the sides of the ground coffee receptacle. The moistness "dissipates" the static electricity and the grounds don't fly as before.
customer_reviews.author: pepeps

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great Bean Grindr
customer_reviews.text: Grinds beans really nice I'm very satisfied with it I don't care about the noise so it doesn't matter to me how loud it is other than that it is loud but it does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Z

customer_reviews.title: Great grind, proportions are off
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder in that it reliably gives the grind needed and is much quieter and more robust than the former model. My only complaint is that the number of cups on the grinder setting doesn't correspond to the number of cups you'd actually make. For example, I need to grind 12 cups worth of beans to make eight cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Gaetan Giannini

customer_reviews.title: This unit creates A BIG MESS ALL THE TIME!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This machine does a good job at grinding. CONS: IT creates a BIG FAT MESS! The opening of where the grounds go into THE CONTAINER is too small and grounds go everywhere. Grounds also go behind the container and has to be wiped out constantly so the container can go back into place. I reached out to the company and they want to send me the same unit as long as I pay them 10$. I will NOT buy another product from them. I also suggest that NO one buy this unit unless you like cleaning up a DAILY mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One year on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cuisinart CBM-18N Programmable Conical Burr Mill after an internet search for the 'Best Coffee Burr Grinder' in May 2012. The price point and reviews made it my hands-down favorite; I paid $53.10 here! After a year+ use I can say that it is a winner for me! There are more than enough gradations in grind fineness for any of my brews and the burr is removable for cleaning. The static issue is annoying but trivial. The display's blue backlight being constantly on is easily solved by just unplugging the grinder. I guess the better alternative might be an ol' fashioned manual grinder. But that's a whole 'nother story.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Boo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darned good coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Pretty darned good coffee grinder. Does not sound like a 747 taking off, reasonably easy to clean, excellent ground coffee. Would have given it 5 stars except for the static buildup. Grounds cling to the sides of the tray and then later to the paper filter. A quick tap knocks these down to where they need to be, but still makes a bit of a mess on and near grinder. Honestly it could just be that these small household grinders are always going to have that issue with static. I like my grinder and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Disregardless

customer_reviews.title: works, but staticy
customer_reviews.text: Good: Grinds evenly and quickly for drip. Not too noisy. Easy enough to clean the burr area and a channel from burrs into the grounds container. Disappointing: Static cling in grounds container for many coffees: makes it tedious and messy to get the grounds out. I prefer my more expensivewhich has less static. Needed a grinder for work, and decided to go for the cheaper Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Apollo

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUY THIS HORRIBLE MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY this product. HORRIBLE DESIGN, Not sure how this made it through R&D. It works terrible, and creates an INSANE amount of static and spews grounds all over the counter every time you grind beans. We stopped using it and switched back to a cheaper, simpler Cuisinart version of burr-grinder. Not worth the $$ and HORRIBLE design. The static and messy spray of grounds does NOT lessen over time with use. Would like to RETURN This product for a full refund. It sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Bother Buying

customer_reviews.title: far I am very pleased with the new grinder
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a Capresso from Amazon in December of last year. It lasted exactly 2 months before it broke and ceased working. I returned it and purchased the Cuisinart for half of I paid for the Capresso. So, far I am very pleased with the new grinder. It is far superior to the Capresso with regard to the quality of the grind and many other features. Save yourself $70 and buy the Cuisinart instead of the Capresso.
customer_reviews.author: Native Son

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does an awesome job. UPDATE: Using this is so much better than buying ground. The flavor you get is terrific. This also lets you experiment with different grinds. For me, I found that 6 gives me what I am looking for in my Keurig for the coffee type I have now. I am ordering different types of coffee from an on line vendor and because the prices are decent I have gone through 6 or 7 varieties so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Marsala

customer_reviews.title: It was a used product.
customer_reviews.text: This product had been used. I took it out of the box and there was grounded coffee inside of the mechanism as well as inside of the container it comes out in. Also the lid is missing from this product. I am extremely disappointed and will be returning this product. Update: Reordered this product and the second one was still used and just gross. This is the first time I have been truly disappointed with an Amazon purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This little guy sure is useful
customer_reviews.text: Good for the grinds, just not good when you need to turn it on for the grind, if you have to brew in the morning, I would say brew you're usual amount before the morning, so that you don't wake up the dead.
customer_reviews.author: Marrynitha Sakun

customer_reviews.title: This is much better -- more consistent grind & way less fine powder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after trying to use grocery store grinder for a french press. This is much better -- more consistent grind & way less fine powder. Personally, I think it's plenty coarse for french press (I use one of the less coarse settings for French press because the coarser seemed not to extract enough & seemed weak). The auto setting for a cup seems to be set at about half of what most directions suggest -- about 1 tbsp or 5 grams for one cup, so I set it for double what I'm making & is ok (maybe still a little light). Used it for pour over & it worked well. Haven't made espresso, so don't know about that.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Creates an Incredible Mess! - Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder functions adequately but in grinding beans, it creates a tremendous amount of static electricity. When you open the reservoir after grinding, it's literally like a coffee explosion. Grounds EVERYWHERE! It's an incredible mess to clean up on a daily basis. I've stopped using it as the hassle and mess it creates far overshines the ability to have fresh ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John Haven

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just under a year before first malfuntion.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this grinder 1 year and 6 days ago. Average use is twice a week. In the last two weeks, the button for automatically grinding the preselected amount has stopped working. We can only use it by holding the manual grind button. It grinds very well and is quieter than our last Cuisinart burr mill - which only lasted about a year. Before the button / electrical malfunction, I would have rated this 5 stars. Now it seams it's failing and I will think twice about replacing it with a Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Custom

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift and my husband wasn't sure if he was a fan or not. After one week of use, he LOVES it! He likes how quickly it grinds, that it grinds exactly what you need, grinds the desired coarseness and that the coffee tastes so good with freshly ground beans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Grind settings are a tad on the smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Grind settings are a tad on the smaller side, but workable (Auto-Drip & French Press). There is some static that effects the grounds collection bin, but the results are fresh ground coffee every morning.... Worth the minor inconvenience.... I love this enough that I plan on gifting to a some coffee loving friends
customer_reviews.author: Patient

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately When you read the views you think OMG this the the best product but it is not! It’s noisy and the grinding is not that perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bell

customer_reviews.title: The grind settings are great. The device is mostly easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The grind settings are great. The device is mostly easy to clean, except for the spot between the grinder outlet and the basket inlet. My only gripes with this product is the static cling that occurs when you grind the beans. Once you pull the catching basket out after a grind, the grind will stick to the basket. This makes putting the grinds into something a bit messy.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Best conical burr grinder for the $
customer_reviews.text: Love it - I upgraded to this conical version from the cuisinart but grinder, which broke on my after 4 years. This conical version is amazing and at a great price. Love the preset grind length by cup and this produces both really fine powder for espresso as well as evenly course grinds for French press. The coarse grind does a pretty good job at evenly sized granuls, but it still results in a very small amount of powder in the bin - something only very $$$ versions do better.
customer_reviews.author: deepatl33

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.......but
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a blade grinder and the difference is incredible. I've been using it for two weeks now, experimenting with the 5 grind espresso settings. I'm now using #4 at 6 cups which yields 2 double shots for my taste. Two issues, No on/off switch and it's messy, really messy. It's not like I didn't read the other reviews so I'm not complaining. It is what it is. For the price I think it's a great product. Just be sure to keep a damp sponge handy. Oh, I have it sitting on a small tray which helps a little with the clean up.
customer_reviews.author: akawanda

customer_reviews.title: Their measurements are WAY off!
customer_reviews.text: I love the grinder. Large hopper, fairly quiet (for a coffee grinder), quick, with fairly even, consistent grind size. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the factory suggestions are not even close! In my 12 cup Bunn Auto-drip, the right flavor for me is to use grind size 3 (largest espresso grind), and FOUR cups! When I set the quantity for 10 or twelve, I get more ground coffee than the coffeemaker basket will even hold! So, there was about a week's worth of experimentation to get the right settings. Other than that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Cast Iron Chef

customer_reviews.title: Grinder container does not stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Overall the grinder does OK actually grinding beans but I have the same problem with this grinder as I have other Cuisinart grinders. The container that holds the grinds never stays in place and requires me to hold it into the device in order to grind my beans. Not the end of the world however very annoying in which I cannot just push the button and walk away. I think I am over purchasing Cuisinart grinders in the future and going back to Bodum.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaG

customer_reviews.title: Messy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this grinder for over a year, but It doesn't bring me Joy. It does the job, but makes a mess every time, and sometimes kicks out the hopper before the job is done which leaves you with an unknown amount of ground coffee. I'm getting something better.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer Engineer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but hate the mess
customer_reviews.text: It works great, coffee is ground evenly and doesn't get hot to quickly. It's also very quick. Grinders will always be noisy and messy, but the one downside of this one is static electricity. The ground seem to stick to everything no matter what I do. I make sure a fairly large area of counter is cleared and cleaned off before starting.
customer_reviews.author: Andy J.

customer_reviews.title: I am happy but,
customer_reviews.text: I do enjoy this machine and the coffee I drink from it everyday. My problem is how messy it is to grind the coffee. I really do not look forward to grinding it. There are coffee grounds all over the counter on the clear bin, and even on my kitchen floor. It is a big mess. I wish someone would tell me if there is a solution to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Cancienne

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for FRENCH PRESS
customer_reviews.text: Works well on the coarse (level 18) setting for use in a french press. Only drawback is that it is loud and scares my dog and cat (although I think any grinder would make a similarly scary noise for pets). It grinds quickly on the coarse setting.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lees

customer_reviews.title: Finicky, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: We've had more problems with this grinder than any I've ever owned before. We purchased because the reviews were good. If the coffee ground container is slightly out of place it will not work. If there is a dusting of coffee grounds anywhere, it won't work. We've had to purchase a special brush just to get coffee out of all the cracks in hopes that it might decide to grind the beans. I've given this machine a fair chance but it's about to go in the trash. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder, but messy
customer_reviews.text: Grinds well. It is a bit messy as other reviews mentioned. The blue display is brighter than I expected. Wish the container was a little bit bigger. It almost holds a bag of coffee but not quite.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Holt

customer_reviews.title: ... 50 times now and it still grinds just as good. Very loud but also awesome with the different ...
customer_reviews.text: I mush have used this 50 times now and it still grinds just as good. Very loud but also awesome with the different settings and quality of the grinding.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Davis

customer_reviews.title: The right grind
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart Conical Burr Coffee Mill provides exactly the right grind for my Aeropress. It doesn't leave a mess and the container has flat sides that allow pressing the scoop to get a uniform measure. It is quite noisey, but I grind what i need the night before. It's a big improvement over my ancient Braun mill.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good grind but messy x2
customer_reviews.text: The burr grinder works very well however the seal between the grinder and dispenser is non-existent. So after you have successfully grounded your beans you have a substantial amount of coffee residue on your counter requiring cleanup. If you apply some pressure to the container it helps alleviate the mess a bit but I did not see that being in the product description. So-so product
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: Grinds Great, Grounds Irksome
customer_reviews.text: Does a superb job grinding and seems to be holding up well after consistent every day use. It's also enthusiastically cacophonous. The grind collector makes a bit of a mess on the counter every time you take it out. EVERY time. Is this the toll for perfectly ground beans? Am I unrealistic in my culinary expectations? Do deep psychological issues cloud my product reviews? I don't know. Ground coffee on a white counter top is something so starkly obvious, however, I just can't pretend it's not there, unlike the other messes I leave for my wife. She is a patient woman.
customer_reviews.author: J. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Features are nice and the grind is good but so much static ...
customer_reviews.text: Features are nice and the grind is good but so much static cling with the grind. No mater how much tapping I did the static in the grind was just too much. Every time I used it I had to clean up the counter and coffee maker after with a sponge to get up all the grinds. Replaced it with a Capresso 560 Infinity and the static is almost non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, but Huge Mess
customer_reviews.text: This grinder does a great job with grinding and is easy to set up for a consistent cup of coffee, but I wish I'd heeded the comments about the static cling. We have grounds everywhere. Tapping doesn't help, nor a damp towel. I wish I'd gotten something else. I can't believe they couldn't have done something better to handle the grounds. Otherwise, this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder until I tried to clean it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder until I tried to clean it. I couldn't get it back together so it would work. I called Cuisinart this week to tell them about my problem and seek a solution. No hassle. They are replacing the unit. Very satisfied with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Barragar

customer_reviews.title: Messy but usable
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it makes a lot of mess, as ground coffee doesn’t go directly into plastic container sometimes, some of it escapes and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We love this grinder. It’s super quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: I like the flexibility associated with being able to select the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has met all my expectations for grinding. I like the flexibility associated with being able to select the grind coarseness and number of cups of coffee to grind for. Only thing I do not like is the clean-up after grinding as coffee escapes during the grinding process and requires clean-up around the grinder after the grinding is complete. I have not had a burr grinder before so this may be true of all burr grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Rasbyron22

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE STATIC -  MAKES A MESS
customer_reviews.text: I don't make many reviews ! But I had to warn people about this grinder. what ever happened to Quality control ? This is a Top name brand,I guess that doesn't mean anything any more. Looks great, Grinds great, a little noisy ! But the static in the ground beans is horrible , It not only sticks to the container , But to my fingers ,and Jumps to the plastic on the Pot
customer_reviews.author: MR. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Really good grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Grinder works very well. Lots of grind adjustments from very coarse to quite fine. Very easy to use, and easy to clean. Static isn't a huge issue for me. Plus, the consistency of the grind more than makes up for any minor cleanup. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Mess
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Easy to use. Dial in your settings and hit start and it makes the correct amount of ground coffee to your specifications. CONS: This thing makes a huge mess. For some reason the coffee grinding creates a static area on the hopper. When you pull out the hopper the coffee grounds fly all over the place. VERY MESSY! Has Anyone else had this problem or just me?
customer_reviews.author: S C

customer_reviews.title: Super messy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This grinds fine but it makes a big mess. I loved it at first, but coffee grinds all over, no matter how hard I try to be neat about it. I don't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Njm

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this grinder
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this grinder. Everything's adjustable. The only gripe I'm concerned about losing is the lid on the collecting canister, or how hard you have to bang its plastic body to get all the coffee out of its weird shape. Other than that it exceeds expectations on build and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wise

customer_reviews.title: A MIRACLE TOY!
customer_reviews.text: Man did I need this and it is everything the writeup said it is. I love the blue lite so I can read the numbers easily and it works very quickly. The amount of settings for the grind will make any coffee snob happy and the easy dump bucket that the ground coffee ends up in is quite easy to empty into any coffee holder/ceramic jar. Grind a cup or several at a time, this machine can handle it and then stores quickly and take sup very little room.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Urlaub

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with every coffee mill I have ever used with the plugging of the delivery port with ground beans after as few as 10 uses. This mill after 30 days shows no signs of restriction, same bean brand and same grind. The design change from most others is the delivery port faces down which collects almost no material. The static charge in the ground container is present in all grinders I have used and will hold less charge after a few washings. I tap the container after grinding is finished and before removing and again before pouring into the coffee maker, very little spill. So far the best mill I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Deangeli

customer_reviews.title: Messiest appliance ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder -- EXCEPT for the clean-up. The plastic grounds container is made of plastic, and you will not believe the mess static electricity can make. Coffee grounds literally jump out of the container all over the countertop. It's not unusual to have a full tablespoon of grounds all over when I'm done grinder one potfull of coffee. Shame on Cuisinart for not addressing this problem. I wish I had sent it back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: MLZ52

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it... messy
customer_reviews.text: Does not contain the ground coffee in container. Coffee grounds fall out of grinder when you take container off
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Grinds fine but very messy
customer_reviews.text: It grinds fine, but is very messy. It is impossible to grind coffee without getting it all over the grinder and the counter and the floor, etc. The problem is not just the typical static issue that is common with most grinders. Our previous burr mill was much, much cleaner, but not available for sale when it needed replacement after a few years of admirable service. I believe the design of this one is at fault. Much of the mess happens when I remove the top of receptacle of the ground beans.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. B.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t grind a single coffee bean
customer_reviews.text: Broken right out of the box. LCD screen blinked no matter what, all the removable pieces were removed and replaced according to the manufacturer’s instructions to no avail!! No time for that nonsense; returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Derek J. Schreifels

customer_reviews.title: Static electricity.
customer_reviews.text: Creates a LOT of static electricity. If you use this for an espresso machine, make sure you own a Dustbuster, because you’re going to make a mess. Besides the mess, does do a great job at grinding, makes a consistent grind.
customer_reviews.author: maklein

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good grinder. A little bit of a pain to clean, but found it’s easiest to blow out with canned air outside, makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: FBS

customer_reviews.title: Grinds perfectly to the size you choose and looks soooo cool in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Have this grinder for over a year not and still works as if out of the box. Grinds perfectly to the size you choose and looks soooo cool in the kitchen. Many complain about electrical statics in the plastic box with is true but no big deal at all. First, its inside the box and not outside and if u use the scoop provided to take out the coffee and there is still mess i guess its their fault and second, with a light bang of thr box on thrmkitchen table all eletric static is gone. One of the best buys i made ever
customer_reviews.author: Inbal Tubi

customer_reviews.title: The finest option is not fine enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought it thinking about grinding a fine coffee, and we use in Brazil, but the finest option does not even grind a fine coffee for auto drip. Maybe this is an American pattern, but for me, it was not satisfactory. Grinding in option 1 (the finest possible), it gives me a "watered" coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Chiachiri

customer_reviews.title: What a mess...
customer_reviews.text: I thought the other reviews about static cling were a joke. They were not. I've never seen such a poorly designed product. Perfectly ground coffee doesn't matter if most of it winds up on my counter top. Cuisinart should be embarrassed releasing a product this poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: It's the messy to use
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this at all, it's extremely messy when you use it, coffee grounds go everywhere on your counter and floor even as much as you try to keep it contained, even tried laying newspaper under it on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Just not Durable for the cost
customer_reviews.text: very simply - this item is not durable. I just threw away my second unit in 3+ years. I purchased my first Cuisinart programmable grinder in late 2013, it stopped working early in 2016. I initially was disappointed, but liked the results of the grind, so went ahead and purchased a replacement of the exact same grinder. Yesterday (January 2017) unit failed to work and I placed it in the garbage. Very disappointed. Again, great grinder while it lasts...but just not durable...keeping in mind that I only grind beans two times per day. I'll be looking for a better and more reliable replacement this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from NYC

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding controls, Good grinder
customer_reviews.text: Digital controls are easy to see and to set. The amount needed for a cup is far off - grind 5 cups / 40 grams for 12 cup vacuum brewer. Grinds quickly and fairly quietly. Uniform grind with little dust. Uniformity allows a finer grind for better extraction with same flavor - use less coffee. It makes the expected small deposit of grinds outside the ground coffee receiver.
customer_reviews.author: jeanh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: So I bought a burr grinder for French press. It was horrible! Replace it with this one and I'm very happy so far as it grinds perfectly with no powder.
customer_reviews.author: greg owen

customer_reviews.title: Stops grinding...NOT with the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this grinder at first, other than the noise. However, after a few months it began grinding less and less coffee at the same setting. Now, a year later, I have to run it for a minute just to get enough coffee for 8 cups. I'm ready to throw it out. Not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: dave p.

customer_reviews.title: Static Electricity makes HUGE mess everytime.
customer_reviews.text: Somehow during grinding, the grounds get statically charged when they fall into the collection bin. then when you remove it and the lid to pour the grounds out, they spray everwhere making a huge mess. I have no idea how the grinder is adding this much electric charge to the grounds. Other than this one drawback, the unit is very well made and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: transam617

customer_reviews.title: Not fine enough for high end espresso machines
customer_reviews.text: Works great now for a couple years. Espresso is ground fine enough for my Delonghi EC155 (best selling budget machine on Amazon!) but I've noticed it just doesn't have the fineness necessary for a more robust espresso machine. Remember coffee fanatics: You pay for what you get in grinders and machines! If I had to do it again, I would spend at least $200 on a grinder.
customer_reviews.author: JetFuelOnly

customer_reviews.title: Burrrr
customer_reviews.text: I grind my coffee and it does an excellent job
customer_reviews.author: John Caplinger

customer_reviews.title: I love this burr-grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this burr-grinder. Meets all expectations even though it gets a little "dirtier" than I would like. However, that is the nature of a home grinder that "does its job" and cleans up easily. Electronics are just fine and too the point, no silly extra settings.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wayne D. Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far it works great and for the price it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: BRETT F

customer_reviews.title: very decent grinder, 4 stars!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder! The different settings allow many different grinds and they are uniform, The only part I am concerned about is the safety interlock actuator, it gets buildup and you have to kind of be a little forcefull to seat the receptical back in. not much else wrong with this grinder. i like it and am very happy with it, had it now for few months and grind 3 pots of coffee daily with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: This is a great appliance to have
customer_reviews.text: This is a great appliance to have! A little messy but it is a coffee grinder so it is supposed to be. A great unit with the multiple settings and adequately sized bean hopper. I love having the option of grinding as much or as little as I want in any given week.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Simply great. Packed with features you weren't sure you needed.
customer_reviews.text: We run to bed and breakfast and needed a grinder. The conical burr does a very good job of making a uniform grind. Wasn't sure I needed it to be programmable but have found it a tremendous convenience. No measuring needed. Simply put the beans in the hopper, set the grind level, and it will grind that precise amount of coffee. Simply dump contents into the filter and you are ready to go. Our guests are impressed. It is a bit loud but the results are an impressive cup of coffee. The grinder's features make it a good value.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Very good grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Love the even grind, and consistency! I would buy this again, and may do so for work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the way it grinds coffee so quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it grinds quickly. The light shows what grind it is and how many tablespoons are to be ground. The only complaint is that it spills coffee grinds, regardless what I do to contain them in the container.
customer_reviews.author: sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Great grind, very, very messy
customer_reviews.text: i like the grinder itself, easily adjusted and quality. The plastic container that receives the grinds is truly a thing of horror. Static builds up on it and grounds stick to it. The opening is too wide and grounds tend to fly everywhere. It is the Achilles heel of an otherwise great burr grinder
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that it would be too loud, based on some other reviews. It is certainly audible, but nothing like the large machines for grinding wheat berries at home. It does a good job grinding coffee beans for use in a French press. Some coffee bits get on the counter while cleaning, but the same thing happens using a coffee grinder with metal blades & lid.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C

customer_reviews.title: Performance is good. Grounds are good
customer_reviews.text: I usually make French press style and this has an option to dial in ground size. Performance is good. Grounds are good. Not difficult to clean. Other reviews make a comment about grounds all over the counter. Perhaps it's the the more coarse grounds for French press, but I don't find any mess after grinding and transferring to a storage container. All in all very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Willett

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Spills a little mess of coffee grounds every time you pull out the receptacle, but otherwise this is an excellent grinder! Have used it every other day for probably a year now, and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in NC

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Ground For Every Pot
customer_reviews.text: As much, as finely ground, when you need it, with a nice reserve so you simple touch one button & the conical grinder delivers perfectly evenly ground coffee for weeks. Cons: The grinding process creates statically charged coffee grinds which can cling to the grinder requiring periodic clean up. Worth it for perfect coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Capt DK

customer_reviews.title: Fine grinder, but don't like leaving it plugged in ...
customer_reviews.text: Fine grinder, but don't like leaving it plugged in all the time. When you do re-plug it you have to reconfigure the settings - could use nvram or some sort of memory
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Hamilton

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Programmable Conical Burr Mill, Stainless Steel, COMPACT
product_meta.description: Color:SilverThe elegant brushed stainless steel Cuisinart Programmable Conical Burr Mill produces perfect results every time for all your coffee needs with 18 settings, from extra coarse for your French Press to extra fine for rich espresso. The conical burr grinder produces a uniform grind without sacrificing the natural oils of your coffee beans for rich, flavorful results. With an easy-to-read LCD display showing the time, fineness, and number of cups, coffee is easy and fresher than ever.
feature_bullets: Cup selector from 1-14 for your precise amount of coffee
18 position grind selector from ultra-fine for espresso to extra coarse for French press.
Removable grind chamber, heavy duty motor, cord storage. BPA Free
Conical burr grinder delivers a full-flavor, uniform grind without heating the beans.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars727 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
